page.title: 09RELIGION IN SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: Once there was a Methodist chapel in the village, but that has been demolished. However, there is the church of St James (Church of England), and a Baptist Chapel, built in 1797. At present there is no Baptist minister so the Manse stands empty. The vicar is also retiring very shortly and it may be some time before a new one is found. There is no Sunday school at the church, so several children who go to church have joined the Baptist Sunday school, which has about fifteen members. There is good co-operation between the churches and at some functions both help each other to raise money for their church.
